meanings.sent1: The antiprogressive attitude towards new technology slowed down the company's growth.
meanings.sent2: The antiprogressive policies of the government hindered social development.
meanings.sent3: The antiprogressive stance on innovation made the team seem stuck in the past.
meanings.sent4: Her antiprogressive views were like a heavy anchor holding back societal advancement.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds of antiprogressive thinking loomed over the horizon of progress.

meanings.definition: A person or group that opposes progress or change.
meanings.sent1: The antiprogressive was always skeptical of any new ideas presented in the meeting.
meanings.sent2: As an antiprogressive, he constantly resisted any changes to the traditional way of doing things.
meanings.sent3: The antiprogressive's stubbornness in embracing change often led to conflicts within the team.
meanings.sent4: She saw the antiprogressive as a roadblock on the path to improvement.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the antiprogressive in the group was like a rock in the river of progress.
